meanings.definition: A person or thing that obstructs or hinders progress or action.
meanings.sent1: The stubborn obstructor refused to move out of the way.
meanings.sent2: The fallen tree on the road acted as an obstructor to the traffic flow.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel became an obstructor by hiding nuts in the path.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure was an invisible obstructor in her pursuit of success.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds looming overhead served as an ominous obstructor to the sunny day.

meanings.definition: To block or hinder the progress of something.
meanings.sent1: Please do not obstructor the entrance with your bags.
meanings.sent2: The construction work obstructor the usual route to the park.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to obstructor the dog's path with a toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: His doubts began to obstructor his confidence in completing the task.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog obstructor the view of the mountains, making them appear mysterious.
